summary: This is an email chain from November 30, 2018, discussing various lawsuits related to Jeffrey Epstein. It clarifies that a December 4 trial involves a malicious prosecution lawsuit filed by an attorney (who represented Epstein's victims) against Epstein in Palm Beach County Circuit Court. The email also mentions a federal suit by victims against the government regarding victim notification, which involved a motion for summary judgment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the lawsuits discussed; being sued for malicious prosecution by an attorney who represented his victims, and was the defendant in the victims' federal suit.

persons.name: Unnamed Attorney
persons.context: An attorney who represented multiple victims of Epstein and is now suing him for malicious prosecution in Palm Beach County Circuit Court, claiming Epstein's prior lawsuit against him was retaliatory.

persons.name: Unnamed Law Partner
persons.context: The law partner of the attorney suing Epstein, who was convicted of fraud related to an Epstein business, which was the basis for Epstein's prior lawsuit against the attorney.

connections.description: The attorney is suing Epstein for malicious prosecution, claiming Epstein's prior lawsuit was retaliation for the attorney representing Epstein's victims.
They were law partners; the partner's fraud conviction related to an Epstein business was used by Epstein in a prior lawsuit against the attorney.
The law partner's fraud was related to an Epstein business, indicating a prior business or financial connection.

events.title: Scheduled Trial for Malicious Prosecution Lawsuit
events.description: A trial was scheduled for December 4, 2018, in the malicious prosecution lawsuit filed by an attorney (who represented Epstein's victims) against Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach County Circuit Court.

events.title: Motion for Summary Judgment in Federal Victim Suit
events.description: There was a motion for summary judgment in a federal lawsuit filed by victims against the government, focusing on victim notification issues, involving communications between prosecutors and Epstein's attorneys.

events.title: Epstein's Prior Lawsuit Against Attorney
events.description: Epstein previously sued the attorney (who represented victims), claiming the attorney was involved in a fraud committed by the attorney's law partner related to an Epstein business.

events.title: Conviction of Attorney's Law Partner
events.description: The law partner of the attorney suing Epstein was convicted of fraud related to an Epstein business.

keyFacts: An attorney who represented multiple Epstein victims filed a malicious prosecution lawsuit against Epstein, with a trial scheduled for December 4, 2018.
The malicious prosecution claim stems from Epstein previously suing the attorney, alleging involvement in a fraud committed by the attorney's law partner related to an Epstein business.
A separate federal suit by victims against the government involved a motion for summary judgment centered on victim notification procedures.
The email clarifies that the December 4 trial is not the victims' lawsuit against the DOJ or directly against Epstein, but a retaliatory litigation case filed by a victims' attorney.
